attributes.action: Protect Local Authority centrally held funding for Early Years Intervention
attributes.background:
Government changes to Early Years centrally held funding are threatening the existence of the outstanding Pen Green Centre, a pioneer in early years integration. 
NCC funds the majority of the centre's work via the centrally held fund and changes will inadvertently see a savage reduction in budget.
attributes.additional_details:
We know DfE did not intend to threaten the country’s largest and most innovative nursery school.
Whilst we support the principle of funds being redirected to the front line we urgently request the government ring-fence funds for Pen Green and other integrated nursery schools before February 2017. 

Furthermore we urge the government to enact a caveat to the future funding arrangements whereby integrated nursery schools are protected financially to continue their outstanding work from hereon in.

attributes.action: Military personnel to have military hearing before they proceed to civil courts.
attributes.background: In the past any suggestion of wrong doing by military personnel was investigated by the military - if any was discovered and thought to be serious enough it was passed to the civil courts to deal with.

attributes.action: Ban the use of inhumane rodent glue traps in the UK
attributes.background:
Rodent glue traps are mats covered in a very sticky adhesive from which it's victims cannot escape. It can take hours, even days from being caught to being killed, in which time they will usually die from exhaustion in the attempt to escape.
Let's get these disgusting things banned. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Ireland and New Zealand have banned glue traps and many major stores around the world have stopped selling them.

attributes.action: UK GOVERNMENT TO ACTIVELY PURSUE URGENT PEACE NEGOTIATIONS IN SYRIA
attributes.background: How long will this unrelentless suffering, mass destruction  and massacre of innocent lives continue to be silenced, ignored and accepted by the international community ?
attributes.additional_details:
After six years the Syrian civil war is increasing with rage  with no end in sight. 
Since the  war began, as many as 386,000 people have been killed, including nearly 14,000 children.  The war has become more deadly since foreign powers have joined the conflict.  The only way to end this catastrophe is for the world to stand together and remove Assad and his regime. 

Eastern Aleppo has become the key strategic battleground and an epitome of this brutal, barbaric and morally shameless and tragic war in Syria.  It has been besieged, bombed, starved and strangled as part of the Assad’s regime ‘Starve or Kneel’ strategy. 

Let's show the innocent children of Syria and its people that their lives do matter, that we do care and the world has not forgotten!

attributes.action: Demand routine testing for dangerous and fatal infections during pregnancy
attributes.background: In 2014, I was pregnant with my daughter. I visited my doctor complaining of abdominal pain and was not testing for anything. A few weeks later I was rushed to hospital in preterm labour, and my baby was delivered at 20 weeks. She survived only 2 hours. I had chorioamnionitis that went untreated.
attributes.additional_details:
•25% of preterm labours are due to emergency events, including undiagnosed infections
•These infections can be detected with examinations, urine cultures, vaginal/rectal swabs and blood tests 
•If left undetected can cause inflammation of the fetal membranes/amniotic sac, leading a medical emergency named chorioamnionitis 
•Can trigger preterm contractions, premature rupture of membranes, placental abruption and imminent delivery 
•Delivery prior to 24 weeks is fatal, and otherwise dangerous

attributes.action: Prevent Ministers and MP's to talk until debate runs out of time.
attributes.background: The Government to impose a time restriction on Ministers and MP's to talk in Private Members Bills debates in line with the time given to debate. The current system gives members the opportunity to talk until time runs out, shelving the debate. This is not democratic and discredits the system.
attributes.additional_details: The current system allows for Ministers and Members of Parliament to be able to talk out Private Members Bills when they know they are running out of time. Placing time restrictions on Members of Parliament and Ministers in attendance of the debate in relation to the time that can be given to a debate (minimum or maximum) to stop shelving Bills. Bills should be voted on in Parliament whether they progress to the next stage or refused without a third option, to talk out a debate.

attributes.action: Make congenital heart defect a registered disability
attributes.background: Many babies each year are born with heart defects, these babies face many tests, procedures and surgeries throughout there lives. As an adult with a congenital heart defect I'm facing increasing problems but there's a lack of support as heart conditions aren't a recognised disability.

attributes.action: Provide much needed Truck Stops on the A34 with modern facilities.
attributes.background: The Haulage Industry carries valuable cargo. The A34 needs dedicated Truck stops with advanced facilities e.g CCTV , shower blocks, healthy food outlets. Laybys have no facilties and are a last resort to HGV drivers.Without HGV's our shops would be empty. Drivers deserve a safe secure resting place.
attributes.additional_details: A34 serves our haulage trade out of one of the UK's leading ports, Southampton.The port handles around 14 million tonnes of cargo and 820,000 vehicles per year.With the port expanding by a third, freight on our roads will increase.Already there is inadequate spaces for HGV to park up on their rest times,this will only get worse.Many HGV drivers experience theft of their cargo and fuel, even at a well known service stations.Current services have not grown with the increase of freight on the road.

attributes.action: Increase all workers in the U.K. annual leave entitlement to 14 weeks
attributes.background: In line with with governments white paper for leaving the EU on chart 7.1, U.K. and EU employment law, the workers holiday entitlement is labelled as 14 weeks per year. We would like to see this implemented. We would also like to see the minimum wage across all age groups raised to £10p/h

attributes.action: change the EHC plan to cover disabled students in higher education to 24 years
attributes.background: My son is autistic. We was told that he would have support in education up to the age of 24. He did extremely well at collage and got an overall exam result of merit merit, he got a place in his local Uni only to find that the support he had had in college would cease, just like the EHC plan.
attributes.additional_details: My son although very intelligent in his field, struggles enormously in social situations and becomes anxious and upset with new experiences, people, environments. With the 1:1  support that he had, he managed to cope with college life and did very well there, but he aspired to go to uni to follow his dream. His EHC plan stopped because it didn't  cover higher education. My son is the same person he was before. We are trying to get support for him now from the council but keep hitting barriers

attributes.action: Ban the use of pike gags and lip grips in England.
attributes.background:
Pike gags are a spring device that is used to hold a fishes mouth open to allow for unhooking. They are ban in Scotland as they are a barbaric tool.

Lip grips are a mechanical device that hold fish by the bottom jaw bone with a clamp
attributes.additional_details: Both pike gags and lip grips cause permenant damage to the jaw bone of pike and other boney mouth species

attributes.action: Bring retention bonuses to all branches of the Royal Navy. To retain experience.
attributes.background: Financial retention is currently only offered to engineers, but many other branches are struggling for manpower. We need to retain the knowledge and experience, rather than banking on getting the few that join through the ranks with very little military experience.

attributes.action: Legalise medical marijuana for chronic and terminal conditions
attributes.background: Many people in the UK suffer from painful and life-threatening conditions, such as cancer, MS, and Parkinsons.; the synthetic drugs prescribed can have nasty side effects. Research from around the world has shown that medical marijuana can improve quality of life, with fewer side effects.
attributes.additional_details:
60 peer reviewed studies of medical marijuana
http://medicalmarijuana.procon.org/view.resource.php?resourceID=000884
United States FDA report
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/marijuana-medicine

attributes.action: Re-open the Shrewsbury to Stafford Railway Line via Wellington & Newport.
attributes.background: I attended interview in Cannock. 1 and half hours to get there by Rail. If we had a connection from Shrewsbury to Stafford, via Wellington & Newport I would have only travel fo 43 minutes, half the amount of time. The route should be Shrewsbury to Walsall via Wellington, Newport, Stafford & Rugely
attributes.additional_details: Association of Train Operating Companies, in its Connecting Communities: Expanding Access to the Rail Network report, called for funding to reopen the line from Stafford to Wellington as part of £500m scheme to open 33 stations on 14 lines closed in the Beeching Axe. A group called Shropshire, Telford & the Marches Strategic Rail Group voted to lobby government to invest in reopening the line, a quicker alternative of direct link to London. Estimated cost would be roughly £230 million.

attributes.action: Build a Train Station at the Terminal Building of Cardiff International Airport
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call on the Government to implement the above, accordingly intersecting the railway line which runs adjacent to the airport, and urge the relevant train operators to incorporate it into their regular timetables.

Cardiff Airport is in need of investment in order for it to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people in Wales feel that the airport is not within easy reach of the general public unless they have access to a private vehicle. The remote station in the village of Rhoose is an impractical substitute, and straightforward, competitive alternatives are limited.

This affects local passengers as well as visitors.

Rail infrastructure is not currently devolved to the Welsh Gov’t, and any new stations would be a decision for the UK Gov’t & Network Rail.

attributes.action: Give right to remain for commonwealth citizens who serve in the UK Armed Forces
attributes.background: There are cases of Commonwealth citizens who've served in the UK Armed Forces and once out, do not have the automatic right to remain. One case involves a Jamaican who served in the Royal Navy but his application has taken over a year, meanwhile he cannot work or claim benefits. This must change!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to discriminate against DSS in the rental sector
attributes.background: Make a change to the equality law for people in the rental market. Many working prospective tenants are in receipt of housing benefit or tax credit assistance to make up for the ever increasing cost of monthly rent. Stating 'no DSS' leaves many hard working families with little or no housing options
attributes.additional_details:
Changes to equality law for the rental market came into force in Ireland in January 2016, and as shown on bbc news on 09.03.17 it is a very real issue affecting many people in the UK:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-39102860

attributes.action: We the British public want our govt to offer the hand of friendship to Russia
attributes.background: With Donald J Trump as the new elect president of the United States of America and has recently offered the hand of friendship to Russia and Putin, we the British public do not see this as a threat and we want our government to offer the hand of friendship to Russia also.
attributes.additional_details:
In regards to the Independent newspaper publishing on 13/11/2016 Trump-Putin alliance sparks diplomatic crisis http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/trump-putin-alliance-sparks-diplomatic-crisis/ar-AAke2CD?ocid=spartanntp
We the British public want our government to offer a hand of friendship to Russia to work towards peace.
We the British public want our government to become allies with Russia.
We the British public do not want our government to plan on removing Assad from power in the east.

attributes.action: Pass full-scale Glass-Steagall to break up The City’s Too-Big-To-Fail Banks!
attributes.background: The IMF, the BIS and many financial experts are warning of a new global financial crash far worse than 2008, which will be caused by the same forces: the unbridled speculation in derivatives, and outright criminal activity, of City of London and Wall Street megabanks.
attributes.additional_details: The USA's 1933 Glass-Steagall Act strictly separated deposit-taking commercial banks from speculative "investment banking", which had caused the Great Depression. Its repeal in 1999, on top of London’s 1986 Big Bang deregulation, led to the formation of Too-Big-To-Fail banks. Glass-Steagall is non-partisan: 445 UK MPs and Lords from all parties voted for it in 2013. The “ring-fence” legislated instead allows TBTF banks to continue the risky mingling of investment and commercial banking.

attributes.action: Get idebenone on prescription for patients with LHON
attributes.background: Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON) is an inherited form of vision loss. People with LHON decide to take idebenone to possibly help restore their vision but it costs some over £150 a month with no guarantee that it is the actual drug because of ordering tablets off the Internet to get it.

attributes.action: Regulate the rent of student houses, making it fair for all students.
attributes.background:
In the U.K. Student housing in unaffordable. 

It's clear that Landlords of student houses are taking advantage of students and over charging for their properties. 

Many students within the UK struggle to survive with the remainder of their loan after rent.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the NUS website an average student living outside of London pays £4'834 a year for rent. This is more than half of the maximum maintainance loan you can apply for. Not forgetting a lot of students get much less then this. 

The average student in London pays £6'143 for accommodation. 

We propose that the government takes action to help protect the next generation of academics by regulating the amount student landlords can charge for rent.

attributes.action: Stop Yorkshire Ambulance Services plan to downgrade Honely Ambulance Station.
attributes.background: YAS intend to reduce the cover at Honley Ambulance Station. We believe this will have serious implications for the public.The plans will leave the area devoid of cover for long periods of time.We are asking for your support to protect the service that we provide for the local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Staffing levels are to be reduced by 40% which will result in a 50% decrease in ambulance and rapid response vehicle cover. The area covered by this station includes the Holme, Colne, Dearne Valleys and the Huddersfield area.  The planned reduction to 1 ambulance crew 24/7 will mean this area will be without emergency cover for long periods of time. Statistics show that a high % of life threatening time critical emergency calls are already not achieved due to a lack of available resources.

attributes.action: Make ATOS and other related companies ask for claimants signature on reports
attributes.background: ATOS and related companies providing PIP and ESA assessments should have their assessor gain the claimants signature when filing a report for a capability assessment. This in turn would stop assessors lying in there reports which has been a well known fact for quite some time now.

attributes.action: Improve Rural Broadband by making ISP's more accountable for poor Download Speed
attributes.background: Rural Broadband speeds in Rural areas (especially in East Anglia) are unacceptable.  There is no incentive for Internet Service Providers to improve performance - (they get paid the full monthly fee whatever the download speed) - they are not accountable and need government intervention to improve.
attributes.additional_details: In many rural areas (I live in Aldeby, Norfolk), rural business, farms, pubs, shops and private homes endure download speeds of less than >1mbps.  In this day and age in our digital world this is disadvantaging rural business and communities.  Our children are set school homework on-line and cannot access broadband to research it.  Our businesses cannot operate efficiently and trade effectively, farming business need to operate on-line to embrace new technology - we demand swift action from MP's

attributes.action: Save the UK : Halt the Break-Up - with an Inquiry, then a Referendum
attributes.background:
If the vote to Brexit starts either:
The break up of the UK, or
Separate EU treaties for separate UK countries.

Then Brexit will not cover the whole UK, as voted on.

Save our unity by:
An independent Public Inquiry into Brexit Viability, and then:
A Referendum on the Brexit Deal.
attributes.additional_details:
The inquiry will rate the viability & outlook for each deal plainly.
It will report within a timely period.
It will also propose solutions to the concerns of all voters.
Such as:
* Local government powers/funding to manage migration growth within the UK internally.
* Dual UK/EU citizenship application.

The referendum will provide a distinct range of Brexit deals: hard to soft to halt brexit.

Please complete both actions before triggering a break-up.
This applies to all UK territory & countries

attributes.action: Ensure Local Authorities maintain Road Crossing Patrols for schools
attributes.background: Norfolk County Council are trying to cut certain school crossing patrols from operating, because they deem they do not meet certain threshold criteria and are therefore not necessary. It is another cost-cutting motion, which will see lives of pupils and parents crossing the road put at higher risk.
attributes.additional_details: What price can we put on a child's safety?

attributes.action: Introduce a 10-day guarantee for safer, simpler and faster pension switching
attributes.background:
Pension firms can legally hang on to our money for six months if we request to change provider. They do it to earn more fees and often use delay tactics to deter us from switching. Consumers deserve better. 

Let's get a 10-day pension switch guarantee so we can take back control of our money.
attributes.additional_details:
We deserve the right to move our defined contribution pension pots safely and easily between providers. 

Pension firms that try to stop us from switching are preventing us from taking advantage of better and cheaper pension products. They are also exposing us to risks and scams. 

A 10-day pension switch guarantee would require providers to respect our choice to switch quickly and safely. 

Pensions are our money - we should be in control.

attributes.action: Repeal the European Communities Act, 1972
attributes.background: In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Ted Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change.

attributes.action: Approve TfL's October 2016 plan to transfer management of suburban rail to TfL.
attributes.background: Users of London's suburban rail services deserve a better service. They deserve more reliable, faster, more frequent trains with increased capacity, as proposed by TfL: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network#on-this-page-1
attributes.additional_details: It's been reported today (23/11/2016) that DfT wants joint working between TfL and the rail companies, not takeovers. The rail companies have had years to improve their services, but have failed to do so. The time for second chances has long passed and rail users need to see change and improvements urgently.

attributes.action: Introduce Ombudsman for Future Generations & UN Sustainable Development Goals
attributes.background: The UK government agreed to 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals, including: environmental protection, reducing emissions, clean energy, responsible consumption & production. An Ombudsman to protect the future of humanity against climate change is needed. As is clear policy to enable accountability.
attributes.additional_details: The government must act fast to provide baseline statistics. There must be procedure in place so that those acting against climate change for future generations can be made accountable. An action plan and policy must be clear and transparent. Management of SDGs and climate action must not come under the umbrella of Dept. Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy, it requires its own leader and must be woven into all other departments as it affects all other departments.

attributes.action: Care Home Crisis: Reinstate our licence to continue sponsoring current migrants
attributes.background: ARMSCARE is a care home group, whose licence to sponsor skilled migrant workers was revoked and despite efforts to remedy any errors, our skilled migrant workforce were given 60 days to leave the country. Ensuring our current staff stay, will guarantee the best quality of service to our residents.
attributes.additional_details:
We are an open and honest care home group that aims to provide the best quality of care to our residents and by forcing our staff to leave; it removes the very essence of quality and skill from our core business. 

Recruiting local staff or staff willing to relocate to Norfolk is proving to be virtually impossible because villages such as Docking do not have a regular mobile phone signal, let alone any regular public transport for commuters.
For further information please see: www.armscare.co.uk

attributes.action: Prevent the Government from widening the scope of combat immunity.
attributes.background: Servicemen and women injured during combat will be shut out of the justice system under new Government plans to widen the scope of combat immunity to stop claims of negligence coming to court.
attributes.additional_details: Under the proposals, combat immunity - which provides an exemption from legal liability for members of the armed forces and the government - would apply to all claims brought by those in combat, even when failings occurred far from the battlefield.

attributes.action: Collate the costs of our Refugee effort and charge it to the Overseas Aid Budget
attributes.background: To collate all costs born within the borders of the United Kingdom relating to the Accommodation; Feeding; Clothing; Medical Care; Education: Translation and Judicial costs of refugees both legal and Illegal.    The sum of these collated costs to be paid from the Overseas Aid Budget.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the costs relating to refugees are being born unfairly by local Councils and thus the Taxpayer.  Similarly, the NHS and local social services are bearing additional costs due to translation and capacity issues.   These refugees have left areas where we already allocate aid, their departure therefore reduces the local requirements, but increase costs in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Headteachers should be aware of what disability a child has in mainstream school
attributes.background: Due to a recent observation through out mainstream schools Head teachers should have the duty of care to know and be aware of the disabilities of special needs chilldren.

attributes.action: MPs should be legally obliged to publish their annual tax returns.
attributes.background: We need more transparency in public office. MPs are elected by the public and paid by the public purse. Being an MP should be a full-time job and payment for work outside office should be declared and open to scrutiny. Only by seeing this can the public decide if there is conflict of interests.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for travel time to be paid when part of the job
attributes.background:
In home care industry and possibly many other jobs, the travel time for the job is not always paid.
Carers are getting up early in the morning for shifts starting even at 6am and working until 14:00/15:00. The same carers will return to work typically 2 hours later, to finish their jobs after 22:00
attributes.additional_details:
This makes for most home carers really long shifts and they are only being paid the time they are at the clients, not the time spent to travel between their clients, which according to gov.uk is also working time.

https://www.gov.uk/maximum-weekly-working-hours/calculating-your-working-hours

Imagine being out of your home for more than 12 hours for the job and be paid for 7-8 hours (at best). This pushes the quality of life to a low end.

It should be a legal requirement to pay the travel time at the worker’s normal rate of pay. This should include travel time to and from home if the place of work is not a fixed one.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Protect us from speculative housing development. NPPF needs modification
attributes.background: Ramifications of councils not meeting 5yr land supply include reversal of planning refusals irrespective of poor infrastructure. Sprawling and unsustainable urbanisation is resulting! Councils need more time to prepare local plans to prevent speculative development which is a serious current issue
attributes.additional_details: Gov’t unambiguously demands "sustainable" development in NPPF; Gov't demands for decentralisation & localism are in disrepute. The crass 5yr rule needs modification to consider local circumstances; Councils must be able to manage the reality it creates. Evolving Local Plans leave communities open to unwelcome speculative & unsustainable development!  Inspectors should give more time to councils where land availability is an issue before overturning local decisions – we need protection from this

attributes.action: NHS England to fund second stem cell transplants for all conditions
attributes.background:
In July 2016 it was announced that second stem cell transplants would not be routinely funded by NHS England. Around 74% of patients achieved complete remission after second transplant.

We must get this decision to be overturned to give people the second chance that they deserve
attributes.additional_details:
My farther was diagnosed with Myelofibrosis in 2013 at the age of 46! He had a stem cell transplant at the beginning of 2014, from stem cell donation from his brother. Unfortunately at the end of 2016 we where told that my farther had a relapse, the bone marrow transplant had not been success. Myelofibrosis is a serious bone marrow disorder that disrupts your body's normal production of blood cells.

http://blog.anthonynolan.org/2016/09/nhs-england-and-second-transplants-our-statement/

attributes.action: Schools to teach about invisible disabilities/illnesses
attributes.background: Living with an invisible disability is difficult, most people don't even know what one is, in this petition you are signing to make sure invisible disabilities/illnesses like EDS,PoTS, HMS, CF and many alike are taught within schools to show people that a disability isnt always noticeable by sight.
attributes.additional_details: Living with EDS I find school and most other activities extremely difficult this is not helped by the school or anyone around me not even knowing what it is. People need to be made aware of invisible disability.

attributes.action: Make it law for MPs to see Constituents whether they support them or not
attributes.background: During the Waspi campaign M.P.s have refused to see their Constituents as they don't support the issue.Also, they did not hand in the paper petitions to the House of Commons 11/10/16 and other M.P.s had to do this for them

attributes.action: No discrimination towards naturists and to gain our equal human rights.
attributes.background: We shouldn’t have to be restricted to designated areas and zones for the simple fact of being unclothed. It is a violation to human rights to take away a simple innocent freedom. The public need to understand that naturism is simply innocent, natural living and freedom. We need our equal rights.
attributes.additional_details: Recently it has also proven that people are more happier when in their natural state which I can solemnly declare and thousands of other naturists can too. We need more urban naturist areas. The time for change is now. Check out this recent link for more details about how being nude can make you a better and happier person. http://www.bn.org.uk/news/information/about-bn/science-proves-naturism-is-good-for-you-r396/

attributes.action: Save our Fishermen: Lobby for our fishermen to be allowed to gill net for bass.
attributes.background: We are calling on George Eustice, the UK Fisheries Minister, to reject the Commission's proposals and not to cave in to angling lobbyist.  A lot of our struggling small boat commercial fishermen (under 10’s) depend on netting sea bass to keep their businesses afloat.

attributes.action: Raise the appalling level of farm murders with the South African Government.
attributes.background: The terrible toll of violent attacks and murders against South African farmers and other xenophobic attacks must be brought to the attention of the South African government.
attributes.additional_details: South Africa has one of the highest murder rates in the world.  Attacks against farmers and other non indigenous peoples are out of all proportion to their population numbers.  Over 40 attacks on farms in February alone.

attributes.action: Urge the Bank of England to stop using animal products in £5 bank notes
attributes.background: The Bank of England has confirmed that the polymer pellet from which the base substrate is made contains a trace of a substance known as tallow. Tallow is derived from animal fats (suet) and is a substance that is also widely used in the manufacture of candles and soap.
attributes.additional_details:
Bank notes must be made in an ethical manner, so that they can reasonably be used by the millions of British people who live their lives actively avoiding being complicit in the exploitation of animals or the cruel treatment of animals- including unknowing exposure to any products contaminated by using the flesh or fat or bones from animals, including those killed using the cruel Halal slaughter method.
It is wrong that bank notes contain any animal product or allergens.

attributes.action: Stop free interpreters in the NHS.
attributes.background: Free interpreters are costing the NHS more than £23 million per year. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Make it law for the tethering of horses to be a criminal offence.
attributes.background: A tethered horse is a horse on a length of chain. Unable to move beyond the confines of the chain and often without shelter, sufficient grazing and water. Many are tethered 24/7 and spend their days going round and round in circles. They are not living, just existing. You can help end this.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to see instances of tethered horses and how  despondent and resigned to their fate they look then visit the Facebook page of  Save the Papermill Horses.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate an international intervention on Trump's US climate policy
attributes.background:
The Trump administration intends to revive a fossil-fuel economy and withdraw from the Paris Agreement.

If US climate policy undermines global climate change targets, the UK government should intervene on behalf of the UK population and co-ordinate the intervention of other nations as well.

attributes.action: Slash the Foreign Aid Budget by at least 50%
attributes.background:
The arbitrary target for Foreign Aid spending set by the Cameron Government of .7% of GDP is clearly not working. 

The Department is struggling to spend all of the budget. 40% ends up being thrown at the EU, the UN & NGOs where we have no control or certainty that our money is being spent wisely.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the UK Foreign Aid budge rose to £12.2bn, all of which had to be borrowed.

The Independent Commission for Aid has produced a report saying that "The DfID’s plans are “not fit for purpose” 

The National Audit Office has severely criticised the policy. In 2013 the DfID had to spend £2bn in just 8 weeks to ensure the target for spending was reached !

We have budget constraints at home, particularly with defence, the NHS and Education yet the Foreign Aid budget is ring fenced. 
Why ?

attributes.action: Ensure there's a legal entitlement to contact with siblings and half-siblings
attributes.background:
Individuals should be entitled to contact with their siblings (including 'half-' and step-siblings) under 18, unless the courts deem that there is reasonable concern this would have a negative impact on the child's welfare. 
As the law currently stands, there's no rights of access for siblings.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'nuclear family model' (a father, mother and their children) is no longer representative of the family dynamics within the UK. 
Therefore, we hope a law will be put in place to ensure siblings are entitled to contact with each other, as the law does not currently serve to protect that special, intimate bond they share. If the parent with custody decided to stop access to the other parent, the siblings suffer consequently - being unable to see each other.
